intro: Clethropsis, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Clethropsis species are native to the southeastern United States and are often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and can be either simple or pinnately compound, depending on the species.
